messages: 7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (10:39): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: see this table http://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Key-navigable_custom_DHTML_widgets#The_solution:_changes_to_standard_behavior_of_tabindex
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (10:40): "focusable but not tabable" is crucial
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (10:40): because it's focusable via click or script
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (10:40): and that is how one can do complex container widgets like tree views, grids, etc. via script
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:41): 7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45: a number of us just told 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e the same on #whatwg
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:41): 7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45: btw I think the latest WebKit nightly should have the tabIndex extensions
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:42): if you are interested in trying it
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (10:42): sure i'll have someone do that
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (10:42): probably david bolter (davidb) from ATRC
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (10:43): their grant is to help anyone implementing ARIA including Apple
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:44): our basic accessibility stuff should more or less mostly work on Windows now too
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (10:45): or what do you mean by basic a11y stuff
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:45): MSAA based on intrinsic roles and actions of elements
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:45): same as we do for VoiceOver
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (10:46): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884, do you pass http://tc.labs.opera.com/html/global-attributes/tabindex/ ?
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (10:46): how come the tabindex bug isn't marked fixed? https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=7138
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (10:47): Firefox and Opera still fail some of those (after we fixed them)
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:48): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: I am pretty sure Alice has looked at those tests

139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:48): I think today she worked on making tabIndex parsing more strictly HTML5 compliant (though that doesn't seem to match what other browsers do so maybe should be changed in the spec)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (10:49): the spec should be changed a bit yes
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:49): 7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45: I guess it is not committed yet, my mistake
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (10:49): i think the tests now match what i think the spec should say :)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:49): i'm about to fix the spec
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:49): but should be soon since it has been reviewed
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:50): just playing with the kittens first
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (10:50): ok for a minute there i thought you had a different procedure
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (10:50): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: do the kittens tell you what to do in the spec?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:51): given their obsession with the keyboard, they seem to be just tryin to edit it directly
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:51): 7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45: well, sometimes we do forget to close the bug, but I double-checked trac
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (10:51): pweeze dont hoit da webz
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:52): please, they have better spelling than that :-P
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:04): is tabindex=-2 the same as omitted tabindex or the same as tabindex=-1 ?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (11:05): all integers are valid tabindexes
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (11:05): except maybe for +integer
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (11:06): i should rephrase that, all integers optionally preceded with a hyphen
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (11:07): that's an integer preceded by a hyphen
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (11:07): or did you not mean it in the math sense
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (11:08): -0 is fine
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (11:08): -+1 or --1 prolly not
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (11:08): anything < 0 means the same thing no?
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (11:08): how are we defining "fine" now? what should be allowed or what browsers handle?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (11:09): both :)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (11:09): http://tc.labs.opera.com/html/global-attributes/tabindex/002.htm
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:10): none of that really answers my question :-)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (11:11): -x where x is a positive integer is identical to -1, yes
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (11:11): hopes he got it right this time around :)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:12): ok
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:12): and we want that to be conforming?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:12): as opposed to requiring it to be -1
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (11:12): no opinion
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (11:13): it might give authors slightly less to think about or slightly more, dunno :)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:14): I recall someone stressing that it should be -1 not just any negative number
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:14): I can't recall.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:14): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: have you tested if -2 and -1 do the same thing in IE?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:14): no
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:15): wouldn't have asked if i had :-)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (11:16): checks
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (11:17): works the same
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:17): thanks
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (11:17): (IE6, but that shouldn't matter)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:18): finds http://blog.fawny.org/2005/08/22/tabindex/ by googling for 'negative tabindex'
